summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 28, 2019, discussing the removal of Jeffrey Epstein from suicide watch and psychological observation at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It includes reports on his psychological state, physical complaints (numbness in arm and neck), and issues with his cell toilet. The emails show coordination among staff regarding his movement and conditions.

events.title: Epstein removed from suicide watch/psychological observation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is taken off of psychological observation and suicide watch at MCC New York. Staff report he seems psychologically stable but has physical complaints and issues with his cell toilet.

keyFacts: On July 28, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was removed from suicide watch and psychological observation at MCC New York.
Epstein complained of numbness in his right arm and neck, and an inability to make a fist with his right hand.
Epstein reported his cell toilet ran for 45 minutes the previous night, which he found 'aversive and disorienting,' leading him to urinate in a cup to avoid it.
Epstein complained about being in the Attorney Conference room from about 8 AM to 8 PM daily and reportedly receiving only one meal (a sandwich at about 4:15 PM) the previous day.
The email chain shows staff coordination regarding moving Epstein to another cell if the toilet issue persisted and managing his schedule and meals.
